summary: Website project to promote beauty products.

existing_features.title: Create a responsive marketing website for beauty products with a polished landing page structure including: a hero section (headline, subheadline, primary CTA), featured products section (at least 3 products with image, name, short description), benefits/ingredients section (bulleted highlights), testimonials section, and a footer with navigation and social placeholders.

Apply a coherent visual theme suitable for a modern beauty brand (define a consistent color palette, typography scale, spacing system, and component style) and implement it across all sections. Avoid blue/purple as primary brand colors.
Add a “Subscribe” newsletter UI section with an email input and submit button. On submit, show an in-app success confirmation state. Do not integrate with external email services.
Add a “Contact” section with a form (name, email, message) and persist submissions in the Motoko backend (single-actor). Provide a simple success/failure UI state after submission.
Generate and add required static images for the site to frontend/public/assets/generated and use them in the UI (hero + product images + small icons). Do not serve generated images via the backend.
Add client-side navigation that supports a dedicated product detail view for each featured product, while keeping the existing landing page as the default view.
Create a product detail page UI that displays the selected product’s image, name, and description, and provides a clear way to return to the homepage.
Update the homepage featured product cards so each card links to its corresponding product detail page.

Update the frontend to load products and testimonials from the backend instead of hardcoded in-memory constants, while keeping the existing UI/UX and routing behavior intact (landing page, featured product cards, and product detail page by slug).
Update the frontend Subscribe section to submit newsletter signups to the backend and continue showing the same in-app success confirmation behavior (no external email service integration).

new_feature_requests.summary: Create a promotional website for beauty products.
Implement backend data model and APIs to store and retrieve contact inquiries, including timestamp. At minimum: createInquiry(name, email, message) and listInquiries() for internal use/testing.
Add product detail page(s) and link to them from the homepage featured products section.
Create a backend to manage the website’s data (broader than just contact inquiries).

Extend the Motoko backend (single actor in backend/main.mo) to persist and serve the website’s core content data, beyond contact inquiries, including at minimum: featured products (matching the fields currently used in frontend/src/data/products.ts) and testimonials (matching the fields used in frontend/src/components/landing/TestimonialsSection.tsx). Provide public query APIs to fetch these datasets for the marketing site UI.

Add admin-only backend APIs to manage (create/update/delete) the website content datasets (products and testimonials) using the existing access control system (authorization/access-control and MixinAuthorization) so only admins can modify site content.

Add newsletter subscription persistence to the backend: create a data model that stores newsletter signups (email + timestamp) and implement a public shared API to submit a signup. Also add an admin-only query API to list stored newsletter signups for internal use/testing.

Implement upgrade-safe persistence for newly added backend datasets (products, testimonials, newsletter signups), and ensure existing inquiry persistence remains correct. If an upgrade requires state migration, add backend/migration.mo following the project’s conditional migration policy.
